description: Returns a list of S3 Access Grants instances. An S3 Access Grants instance serves as a logical grouping for your individual access grants. You can only have one S3 Access Grants instance per Region per account. You must have the s3:ListAccessGrantsInstances permission to use this operation.

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A pagination token to request the next page of results. Pass this value into a subsequent List Access Grants Instances request in order to retrieve the next page of results.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantsInstancesList
nested_items.description: A container for a list of S3 Access Grants instances.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantsInstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the S3 Access Grants instance. The ID is default. You can have one S3 Access Grants instance per Region per account.

nested_items.name: AccessGrantsInstanceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when you created the S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterArn
nested_items.description: If you associated your S3 Access Grants instance with an Amazon Web Services IAM Identity Center instance, this field returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Identity Center instance application; a subresource of the original Identity Center instance. S3 Access Grants creates this Identity Center application for the specific S3 Access Grants instance.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterInstanceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services IAM Identity Center instance that you are associating with your S3 Access Grants instance. An IAM Identity Center instance is your corporate identity directory that you added to the IAM Identity Center. You can use the ListInstances API operation to retrieve a list of your Identity Center instances and their ARNs.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterApplicationArn
nested_items.description: If you associated your S3 Access Grants instance with an Amazon Web Services IAM Identity Center instance, this field returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Identity Center instance application; a subresource of the original Identity Center instance. S3 Access Grants creates this Identity Center application for the specific S3 Access Grants instance.
